intro: Hieracium pleonachum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broadly lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium pleonachum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
